title: (49800) Toro - 5 Plaza San Agustín
description: In the Plaza de San Agustín, in front of the Alcázar de Toro. 5 minutes from Plaza Mayor, quiet overnight. Perfectly situated.

title: (49800) Toro - 16 Barrio Carmen
description: Motorhome area recently built by the Toro town hall (still not finished on pavement but well enough to be used). Beautiful views of La Vega del Duero; 2 min till Alcázar de Toro (where the tourist office is located) and 5 min till Plaza Mayor. Toro is medieval and historic town known for its wine, the Grape Harvest Festival, the San Agustín Festival and Holy Week in Tores. If your visit coincides with any of these festivities, you will not get bored, promised.

title: (49800) Toro - 3D Camino Picaltordo
description: Large parking with firm ground and sand. Quiet for the night.

title: (49800) Toro - Unnamed Road
description: Wild and hidden, without access complications. With views of the rock bridge over the Douro River. You can walk to Toro in 10 minutes passing under the train track. Mosquitoes Vineyards and wineries

title: (49800) Toro - 44 Avenida de Carlos Pinilla
description: Parking at the lane side of the Avenue, next to the house of the barracks of the Civil Guard. There is also a field with a greater amplitude. Uncrowded near the center of Toro and the night.

title: () Toro - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful picnic area very close to the Douro River as it passes through Toro, nearby it has a restaurant and a bar on the other side

title: (49836) Toro - ZA-705
description: Rest area on the A11 from Tordesillas to Zamora, near Toros. At the roundabout turn right then directly left (it is well indicated). Arriving on the right a large wasteland rolling with gravel on the ground. There were 3 motorhomes when we arrived, we put ourselves on the same ground. Apparently the police go round and see if all goes well on this ground (we met during their round, no problem). In front of this land, gas station, bar, small supermarket and WC. Everything is open all night

title: (49836) Toro - A-11
description: Nothing fancy, just valid for a night stop. Parking under the trees. At the exit of the highway between Spain and Portugal. Gas station and interchange not far, and 5 minutes from the city. Quiet.

title: (49810) Morales de Toro - 6 Avenida Comuneros
description:
Free Motorhome Area, with drinking water, emptying of Grays and Blacks. 2 tables. Well lighted.
 Bars, restaurant, supermarket, hardware store, kiosk, haberdashery, mechanical workshops, gas station, cellars, liquor factory and wine museum in the same town. Municipal swimming pool in summer, playground for children and bio-health park.

title: (49870) Villavendimio - 3 Calle San Andres
description: Quiet parking on the outskirts of a small village, and small public fountain to refuel.

title: (47112) Los Villaesteres - VA-VP-6701
description: Motorhome services area at Repsol gas station including an open roofed wash station for the campervan and lorries

title: (49840) Vezdemarbán - 29 Lugar Diseminados
description: Parking of the municipal swimming pool, level concrete floor, drinking water and tables. In summer possibility of access to the swimming pool with showers and toilets. Small charming town, you can visit quickly. Recommended.

title: (47520) Castronuño - 13 CL-602
description: Next to the river, a good place to stop over. In summer there is a small Aquapark.

title: (47112) Pedrosa del Rey - 13 Calle Platerias
description: Very quiet place and a few meters from the town. It has a fountain with drinking water and abundant trees and a pond where tranquility is guaranteed. There are several routes to do both on foot and by mountain bike (Wikiloc) a few meters from the parkin, being able to walk and thus take advantage and see the town, it has a shop and bar (plaza del ayntamiento) next to the San Miguel S.XVI church. The town has its charm.

title: (47520) Castronuño - CL-602
description:
3.4km circuit start/end point.

no services

title: (49152) Sanzoles -
description: Since June 2019, Sanzoles has a Motorhome area belonging to the Ruta Raia Norte (the first cross-border motorhome route in Europe). It is located in an area with picnic areas, next to sports courts and the Wine Interpretation Center. The Area has up to 10 parking spaces and a platform for eco-sanitary services for these vehicles, Wi-Fi connection and 24-hour surveillance.

title: (47870) Tiedra - Camino Ermita
description: Hermitage of Tiedra the old one, wooden benches, small shadows, fresh water. Spectacular scenery. And the hermitage is visitable ... There is a cemetery and no one around. Between two small towns. For those who like these places, it has something magical.

title: (47520) Castronuño - 27 Camino Carreter Bóveda
description:
Municipal motorhome area: free discharge of gray and black water and filling with clean water. paying electricity. Las Riberas de Castronuño is a natural area between the towns of Tordesillas and Castronuño. The importance of this reserve resides, fundamentally, in nesting. In addition, it is an excellent wintering area for numerous waterfowl.
Attention! Instead of going to the town hall as the sign says, you have to go to the nearby El Guacamayo bar.
This area and eco-sanitary point has been promoted by the Castilian and Leonese motorhome association. ACYLA

title: (47870) Tiedra - 7 Calle Santa Maria
description: Parking behind Castillo de Tiedra. Children's swings. Magnificent views of the castle, especially at night with its lighting. No services. Nearby fountain, at the access to the Castle.

title: (49154) El Pego - Cañada de Venialbo o Vereda Zamorana
title_short: (49154) El Pego - Cañada de Venialbo o Vereda Zamorana
description: Small forested area. rare in this land of fields. little wooden cabin. not a lot of level ground but good for camping.

title: (47870) Tiedra -
description: Newly opened motorhome area. To date, it is not signposted and we have found out because they have told us about it at the Labanda Interpretation Center that is right next door. It has newly planted trees and an area that can probably park more than 50 motorhomes. It has a place to collect water and empty both gray and black water.

title: (49153) Venialbo - 16 Camino Villalazán

title: (49530) Coreses - 6 Carretera Algodre

title: (49159) Villaralbo - 18 Diseminado Diseminados
description: at the exit of Zamora along the douro. Large strip of grass along a very little used road. Picnic tables and the immediate proximity to the river. Very quiet night. In the morning a few walkers and fishermen.

title: (49022) Zamora - r N-122, 453 Carr. Villagodio, 8 D
title_short: (49022) Zamora - r N-122, 453 Carr. Villagodio, 8 D

title: (49022) - 51E Carretera Tordesillas

title: (47862) Urueña - VP-5606

title: (47510) Alaejos - 182 N-620
description: Behind the gas station. Large esplanade to sleep at night. Good place to rest away from the noise of the Salamanca-Valladolid highway. Very quiet area Possibility of water and shower if the gas station is open.

description: Drinking water source all year round

title: (47115) Bercero - VP-5602
description: Quiet place in a pine forest. It is accessed by a dirt road. It is a place where people go out to walk their dogs, during the day and in the afternoon it is quite busy.

title: (47510) Valladolid -
description: 500m as the crow flies from the road and close to the church on the hill there is a very large picnic area on several levels where you can park among the pine trees. We were only there at noon, but at night and as far as possible on this promontory with a wonderful view. Very quiet place. There is a light socket under the column of the picnic area, on the side of the well is the pillar that faces the other side of the parking lot from the outside

title: (47850) Villanueva de los Caballeros - Área de descanso
title_short: (47850) Villanueva de los Caballeros - Área de descanso

description: Small water fountain next to a kindergarten.

title: (47862) Urueña - 1 Calle de la Costanilla
description: Parking with rest area, picnic tables, water fountain, next to the medieval wall. The city is the first Villa of Spain. Everything is dedicated to the book: Fundación Delibes, museums, etc. Great place to visit the walled city 6 km from the motorway Madrid A Coruña.

title: (47510) Alaejos - 14 Avenida Arrabal

title: (47510) Alaejos - 55 Calle Antonio Machado
description: New parking area for 7 motorhomes and vans with running water and drainage services, in a very quiet area with views of the pretty town of Alaejos, where there are all kinds of services. Tables to eat and sports facilities in case you want to play a game of paddle tennis. Electricity costs and the key can be picked up at the Parchís bar.

title: (47862) Urueña -
description: Quiet parking to spend the day and night. No services

title: (49021) Zamora - 4 Paseo Tres Árboles
description: Fairly flat car park on the edge of a spectacular park. supermarket at 200m

title: (49128) Cañizo - 1 Calle Clavel
description: Ac free parking area of recent construction, with 6 electricity outlets (ask at the bar or at the town hall) spread over 3 posts. Each post has 2 water intakes with a quick connector for hose and drain for gray and black water. It is next to the town's recreation area, which has a playground, soccer/basketball/handball court, paddle tennis court (for a fee, can be reserved at the bar and at the Town Hall). From here you can visit the Villafáfila Lagoons, a crossing point for numerous migratory birds. Only 35 km from Zamora capital.

title: (49016) Zamora - 2 Bajada Tres Árboles
description: Next to a sports center. Near the river and a walk.

title: (47510) Alaejos - Arroyo de la Reguera
description:
Fuente del Caño

you can fill up potable water at a small tap. only filling up bottles, no hose for motorhomes.

acces over a dusty path, some potholes but not too difficult. bigger MH might have problems as the path becomes narrow in the end. 

theres a sign shortly before Alaejos (coming from south on the N-620) to the right that says "Fonte del Cañao". follow the path, turn right at the next crossing, then slightly left (blue arrows on a pole), go straight for about 1.3km, turn right and follow the narrow path through the trees until you see a picnic area to your right, the tap is right behind:)

title: (47100) Tordesillas -
description: Rest area with many shades of pine trees and tables. Good place to make a landing

title: (49028) Zamora - 20 Calle de Entrepuentes
description: Motorhome area next to the Duero River and in the town of Zamora. Children's play area with tables. Ideal to know the old town. It has free loading and unloading services. Suitable for motorhomes below 6 m length.

title: (49023) Zamora - 12 Calle de San Blas
description: Self-service laundry. LavaAhora is a laundry in the Galleries of the Valderaduey Shopping Center (Carrefour). It has Free Parking, Air Conditioning, wifi. Washers and dryers where while you do your laundry, you can do the shopping without wasting a minute of your time.

title: (49005) Zamora - 12 Plaza Puebla de Sanabria

title: (49410) Fuentelapeña - ZA-602

title: (49031) Zamora - 23 Calle del Obispo Nieto
description: Laundromat, very clean and well maintained. Laundry bins, folding table, money exchanger Open daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m.

title: (49027) Zamora - 1 Carretera Carrascal
description: A public building with showers, toilets and electricity. I think it's closed at night, I was here in the afternoon.

title: (49024) Zamora - 129 Calle de la Hiniesta
description: Very clean laundry room, good washers and dryers. Good parking, next to a Polygon. Close to Bars, Pharmacy, Bakery, etc.

title: (49026) Zamora - 7 Calle Pisones
description: Free parking, with water, totally free gray and black water disposal, a park for children and adults, and a large forest nearby for good walks. Old town 10 minutes walk. Supermarkets nearby.

title: (49027) Zamora - 2 Calle los Pelambres
description: Parking next to the river. Quiet place to sleep.

title: (49024) Zamora - 14 Carretera Villacastín-Vigo

title: (49025) Zamora - 20 Paseo de las Vistillas
description: Parking of the Park, next to the soccer field.

title: (49026) Zamora - 26 Calle del Mediodía
description: Free public parking on the banks of the Duero River, near the Cathedral, Castle, ICT, etc. Quiet location away from main roads, children's play area and adjacent riverside walk/bike path. About half of the spaces have very low tree branches above, half thin. Water fountains nearby, but not easy to fill, and bar with summer terrace opposite. Toilets in the adjacent Watermills Visitor Center during opening hours.

name: Camping El Astral
title: (47100) Camping El Astral
description:
Tordesillas, Camino de Pollos, 8.
Camping "El Astral", beautiful site.
Dog, with bath for dogs (free hair dryer) and access allowed to the Bar-Restaurant.

title: (47100) Tordesillas - 7A Calle Gutiérrez Mellado
description: Ideal place to spend the night or visit the site of the city. Very central. At the l'Astral campsite, on the river there is the possibility of emptying gray and black water and loading clean water. Attention market on Tuesday morning.

title: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña
title_short: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña
description: Castrillo de la Guareña has a motorhome area belonging to the Ruta Raia Norte (the first cross-border motorhome route in Europe). The area has picnic areas and a playground. It has 10 parking spaces and an eco-sanitary services platform for these vehicles, Wi-Fi connection and 24-hour surveillance. Avoid the area from August 8 to 12, due to patron saint festivities and possible noise.

address.street: Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña

title: (47100) Tordesillas - 25 Extrarradio Diseminados
description: Parking beach of Tordesillas river Duero.

title: (49720) El Perdigón - 1 Camino Bodegas
description: Private parking of Bodega Los Yugos. The owner, a very friendly man, allows parking. Next to it are the bar toilets. But the best is its food, its underground cellar and the little town lost in the middle of nowhere but only 5km from Zamora.

title: (47100) Tordesillas - 29 Extrarradio Diseminados
description: Swimming pool, football parking lot on gravel with individual trees but mostly without shade. So far from the street that you can't hear any cars. Trash can available. Fresh water about 100m away.

title: (49700) Corrales del Vino - 2 Calle María Paz Ortega
title_short: (49700) Corrales del Vino - 2 Calle María Paz Ortega

description: Parking next to the pool ideal for hot hours and overnight and with recreational area next to the children and eat

description: Asphalt parking, very quiet, with views from a viewpoint to the Douro River.

title: (47100) Tordesillas - 10 Calle Villavieja del Cerro
description: Street closed bondholders quiet views

title: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Unnamed Road
title_short: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Unnamed Road
description: Wonderfully shady place under pine trees, ideal for a break or siesta

title: (47100) Tordesillas - Avenida Santa Teresa
description: Perfect for the night. Grass, picnic tables. Rowing club next door. A superb view. A random place on map, a good surprise. Accessible by camping car also

title: (47641) La Santa Espina - 2 Paseo Generalisimo
description: Recently activated area in a very quiet village, along the Alameda del Río Bajoz. Flat, picnic tables, sand play area with goal posts and trash. In front of the basketball sports area, playground and bar. Above the Rincon Labrador restaurant, comfortable and full of quality. Perfect to visit the monastery of La Santa Espina, with an impressive exhibition of butterflies. Several trails (one to the reservoir).

title: (47134) Torrelobatón - 23 Calle Hospital
description: Earthen parking around the castle of Torrelobaton. It is said that the castle is the best preserved of Castile and Leon, a visit is mandatory. The town is 50 meters away and includes, among other things, an impressive church (the interior is amazing), a plaza and pleasing municipal pools.

title: (49026) Zamora - 177 Diseminado Diseminados
description:
Repsol gas station directly at the exit to Zamora.
Coming from the west (E82) you first have to pass the gas station, turn around and drive back.

Here you can exchange Portuguese gas bottles from Repsol for Spanish gas bottles from Repsol.
Fee for the exchange plus price for the gas filling. Butane is also available.

The staff speak English, are very friendly and helpful.

title: (49730) - A-66
description: Picnic area in both directions. It has only tables and at the moment it has no shade. It has many parking spaces. and several of them for large vehicles

title: (49706) Corrales del Vino - Autovía Ruta de la Plata
title_short: (49706) Corrales del Vino - Autovía Ruta de la Plata

title: (47512) Castrejón de Trabancos - 5 Calle Parajes
description:
motorhome area with six seats and filling and emptying services.
It has a very quiet promenade in which there are two parks for children.

title: (49144) San Cebrián de Castro - 13 Calle Pozo
title_short: (49144) San Cebrián de Castro - 13 Calle Pozo
description: Dirt parking next to the village bar, picnic area with tables, barbecue and drinking water, football and basketball courts, open all year round and free, bar toilets, 50 meters car wash and electric car charging. Very quiet town, very friendly people.

title: (49430) Villaescusa - Cam. de la Calzada de Salamanca
title_short: (49430) Villaescusa - Cam. de la Calzada de Salamanca

address.street: Cam. de la Calzada de Salamanca

title: (47100) Tordesillas - 148 Autovía de Castilla
description: Gas Station and Restaurant Parking, next to the highway. It has a night toilet. Security cameras 24h and security guard at night. Bathrooms for shower close at 10:30 pm

title: (49630) Villalpando - Carretera Madrid Coruña
description: Large and level parking next to a cafeteria. We were tired of driving at night and stopped for the night. The next day we had breakfast in the cafeteria and we continued.

title: (47490) Rueda - 23 Calle Las Eras
description: Motorhome area with water filling and emptying service. There are places for about 7 motorhomes, two of them with shade.

title: (47490) Rueda - 50 Calle Real
description: Parallel to the main street next to the cemetery, very quiet at night, you only hear the highway rushing in the distance. Opposite a very good Vinoteca Maxi. In the area also many Bodegas.

title: (49149) Montamarta - 17 Rincón Reblo
description: Nice shady spot next to the hermitage of La Virgen del Castillo. Good views. Only room for a few vans. Not suitable for motorhomes.

title: (49149) Montamarta - 2 Calle San Vicente
description: New area for motorhomes with a small park for children, paddle tennis court and green area. Leisure: surroundings of the Esla reservoir (fishing, water sports, etc.), municipal swimming pool, sports pavilion (including the pelota court), children's playground. Health: primary care and pharmacy (first-aid kit) Services: gas station, forge workshop, plumbing Residence for the elderly, which includes the "soup kitchen" open to all registered residents. It stands out for being a passing point and a suggested visit on the itinerary of the Vía de la Plata. Among its heritage, the hermitage of the Virgen del Castillo stands out, located on the banks of a branch of the Esla reservoir, and the church of San Miguel Arcángel, which functions as a parish church. Montamarta is popularly known as the "town of the storks", due to its countless nesting sites, invited and motivated to their annual stay by the wetland of the Esla reservoir and the proximity of the Villafáfila lagoons.

title: (49630) Villalpando - 5 Carretera Zamora
description: Coming from Zamora, on the CL 612 at the entrance to Villalpando, turn right before the Repsol petrol station to reach the small bus station. Go around the covered parking of buses and sit on the left, closer to the building to capture the wifi signal (Public) cafeteria and mitigate the noise of the busy national. The place is mundane and without service dedicated to motorhomes, however it is a good plan to spend the night. The cafeteria is open from 7 am to 5 am and the (well maintained) toilets are accessible. The staff is welcoming. The Guardia Civil conducts regular rounds, all night, in the station and in the car park. I also spoke with one of these police patrols, very friendly, who advised me the location and reassured in terms of security.

title: (47490) Rueda - 108 Calle Santísimo Cristo
description: Playground at the end of the main street of the city. picnic area and fountain. Very quiet to spend the night. city ​​with interesting gastronomic offer.

title: (49137) Villarrín de Campos - Unnamed road
description: enabled area with camping tables, lots of shade and a quiet area to spend the night.

title: (49630) Villalpando - 91 Calle Olleros
description: Children's park with fountain and area with gym equipment. 300 meters from the square. Bars and restaurants. Close to the highway, but without noise. Perfect for resting or spending the night

title: (47192) Castrodeza - 42 Calle del Pozo
description: Newly created area. 6 seats. Level and shaded (afternoon). Very calm. All services, except electricity. Next to a children's play area, sports court, paddle tennis and soccer field. Many nearby towns to see. The views from the Peñaflor de Hornija viewpoint are essential. Torrelobaton Castle, Santa Espina Monastery and very close to Valladolid. Exclusive use of motorhomes.

description: In the middle of the shady trees. Dirty from the hunters, but when everyone takes something more than theirs, it's suddenly a beautiful place.

title: (49440) Cañizal - 4 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Near the highway. A little further is a gas station. We spent a quiet night here. Simple and functional. You're standing right now. Okay for one night. Enough space.

title: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - Camino Molino
title_short: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - Camino Molino

title_short: (37429) Aldeanueva de Figueroa - Camino de La Pájara

title_short: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - 11 Calle Río Duero

title: (49162) Andavías - 78 Diseminado Diseminados

title: (49710) El Cubo de Tierra del Vino -
title_short: (49710) El Cubo de Tierra del Vino -

title: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - 5A Calle del Río
title_short: (47132) San Miguel del Pino - 5A Calle del Río

title_short: (49144) San Cebrián de Castro - Camino al Castillo

title: (49144) San Cebrián de Castro -

title: (49135) Revellinos - ZA-715
description: Bird Observatory of the Villafáfila Lagoons.

title: (49136) Villafáfila - 1 Camino Aceña
description: Parking to use if you visit the lagoons. Public fountain.

title: (47132) Tordesillas - VA-VP-5804
description: It is a truck parking lot but now they are expanding and servicing motorhomes. By eating in the restaurant there are hours of free parking. You can spend the night there. There is a guard 24 hours. You can also store the caravan there, you can choose whether to keep it outdoors or in a ship. The price is 35 or 60 euros per month depending on where you keep it.

title: (47480) Fresno el Viejo - 2 Paseo Piscinas
description: Quiet and level place behind the municipal swimming pools. There are tables and barbecues even though right now it is somewhat neglected, I don't know if because of all this Covid. In the town there is everything, you can walk from here and there you can visit a small zoo with a playground and magnificent attention, a nature classroom, a winery with plasticine figures and an ethnographic museum. Very complete to spend the weekend.

title: (49136) Villafáfila - 54 Calle Rejadorada
description: Parking for camper In the city and very close to the lagoons. Very flat concrete.

title: (49742) Riego del Camino - 11 Calle Pozo
description: Perfect place to stop in the shade. Barbecue.

title: (37419) Parada de Rubiales - 29 Calle Despeñadero
description: Park "La Alameda". Good place with several picnic areas, lots of shade, with a good playground for both children and adults. ATTENTION: not suitable for caravans! The passages are too narrow and the streets not wide enough. They have a source of drinking water next to the fronton. Very quiet place to stay en route, a few kilometers from the highway.

title: (49162) Palacios del Pan - 10 Calle Onesimo Redondo
title_short: (49162) Palacios del Pan - 10 Calle Onesimo Redondo
description: Faucet on the street, we drank it.

title: (47491) La Seca - 36 Calle Santísimo Cristo
description: Parking 2 minutes from the main square of the town. In the village, bakeries, butchers, bars and restaurant. The parking lot is located between the funeral home and the cemetery. Quiet place to spend the night. It has no services.

title: (47491) La Seca - 4 Calle Santiago Sanz
description: Municipal parking lot with a source of drinking water, garbage containers and a bar in front with food-type portions and hamburgers. It is also the starting point of wine tourism routes

title: (47491) La Seca - 1 Plaza Olma
description: Parking for several Motorhomes with water point and sewage discharge. You can visit several Verdejo wine cellars.

title: (37799) -
description: Rest area. No service. But there are tables to eat and it's good to take a break or spend a night here.

title: (37429) Aldeanueva de Figueroa - Km 214 CR A-62
title_short: (37429) Aldeanueva de Figueroa - Km 214 CR A-62
description: Gasolineira, rest stop on the highway, you can sleep, sleep 24 hours a day, service at the gas station

title: (49740) Granja de Moreruela - A-66
description: Parking at Valcarce gas station. Highway in north direction. Good place to spend the night on the road. Guarded

title: (49740) Granja de Moreruela - Zamora- Benavente Hwy
title_short: (49740) Granja de Moreruela - Zamora- Benavente Hwy
description: Valcarce gas station with parking for heavy vehicles and cars, it has services open all night and vending machines

title: (37428) La Orbada - Autovía de Castilla
description: In transit for Morocco we stayed for one night and we happily get bored that we had a 4x4 quiet place to go wild

title: (49740) Granja de Moreruela -
description: Sta María de Moreruela Monastery

title: (49750) Santovenia - A-66
description: Large car park along the A66 motorway

title: (37428) Pajares de la Laguna - 35 Calle la Armuña
title_short: (37428) Pajares de la Laguna - 35 Calle la Armuña
description: Approximately 400m after the motorway exit on the left. Great to stay the night in case the car breaks down!

title: (49760) Villaveza del Agua - 32 Calle de Zamora
title_short: (49760) Villaveza del Agua - 32 Calle de Zamora
description: Water fountain. By the roadside. No parking

title: (49760) Barcial del Barco - 2 Calle Ferrocarril
description: Parking next to the old train station and greenway exit there are several tables with picnic benches flat land very quiet the site no noise

title: (37427) Pedrosillo el Ralo - 20 Calle Abajo
description: Very nice and quiet place to stay on the outskirts of the village with a view of a small lake. Picnic areas, water and garbage cans available. Good connection to the motorway.

name: Camping Olimpia
title: (37427) Camping Olimpia
description:
Pedrosillo el Ralo, Carretera Pedrosillo.
Campsite Olympia. Stop for one night, friendly welcome boss speaks French service station opposite. Very pleasant welcome. Very good stopover on the road to Portugal before Salamanca. Very good homemade catering offered for a menu without drinks. We recommend it for a temporary stopover
I would add that the boss is very commercial and super friendly. Very good home cooking.

title: (37427) Pedrosillo el Ralo - Carretera A-62, km 225
title_short: (37427) Pedrosillo el Ralo - Carretera A-62, km 225
description: Service area, you can have a shower
